text: Carmen Sarahí García Sáenz (born on 29 June 1981 in Nuevo Laredo) is a Mexican singer, actress, dancer. == Career == Carmen Sarahí was born in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas. She is a graduate of the Televisa Arts Education Center. He has faced soap operas such as Rubí, Rebelde, Mujer de madera, Palabra de mujer, Ni contigo ni sin ti, El Juramento (Telemundo), and programs like SOS: Sex and other secrets, Como dice el dicho, La rosa de Guadalupe and Decades, where he was part of the musical group Decadance. He was part of the Guzmán team in the program La Voz (Mexico) where he was participating in the third season, reaching the Knockouts where he was defeated by Carolina Ross. She has recorded voices for movies and cartoons. The most well-known work - in animated filmsEl Quiosco Disney, where she voiced Elsa in Frozen and Frozen II. She performed the Latin American Spanish version of the song “Let It Go” (Libre soy) from the movie “Frozen” and of the song “Into the Unknown” (Mucho más allá) from the movie “Frozen II”. On February 9, 2020, Sarahí was called to join Idina Menzel, Aurora and eight more of Elsa's international dubbers to perform the song “Into the Unknown” during the 92nd Academy Awards. Every international performer sang one line of the song in a different language: Maria Lucia Heiberg Rosenberg in Danish, Willemijn Verkaik in both German and Dutch, Takako Matsu in Japanese, Sarahí in Latin American Spanish, Lisa Stokke in Norwegian, Kasia Łaska in Polish, Anna Buturlina in Russian, Gisela in European Spanish and Gam Wichayanee in Thai. == Personal life == She married to José Enrique Dávila on 8 November 2014. They have two daughters, Camila (born on 17 March 2016) and Alexa (born on 14 October 2017). == References == Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Mexican pop singers Category:Actors from Tamaulipas
title: Carmen Sarahí
